main event: A bright blue object the size of a basketball with a tail was observed near Columbus, Ohio. The object gave off a burst of flame and a bright flash of light.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar and visually.
The object hovered briefly, then shot off at high speed in a straight line towards the south.
The weather conditions were clear, with unlimited visibility.
No photographs were taken of the object.
The report concludes that the object was most likely a meteor or a balloon, but could not be definitively identified.
sighted object: A bright blue object with a tail, the size of a basketball
witnesses: Dr. Ralph E. Collins, an employee of Cahill Scientific Glass Company
